page.title: 13DENTON ... recent times.
page.content: The village owes its reputation for being rather sleepy to a by-pass built in the 1930's. A delightful village green slopes up towards the church and a line of cottages in mellow stone which give the village centre the appearance of somewhere in the {Cotswolds.}There is also a fine selection of specimen trees; one an Oak dates back to{Queen Victoria's Coronation. Unfortunately, some of the names of roads have been changed over the years.{"The Gravel", "Sheep Walk Hill" and{"Flannel Row"}now only exist in the minds of village patriots. The village has witnessed a recent growth with the advent of 2 housing estates. The houses lie on meadow land and the site of a{fish pond}and key hole shaped{sheep dip.}Salient reminders of the past.
